texts.definition: The phase or phases that are not the first or last in a game instance.
markups: <style="Definition">The phase or phases that are not the first or last in a game instance.</style>

Gameplay phases are found in some games due to them having discernible different periods of gameplay when the goals and actions in focus vary. The <style="CurrentLink">Middlegame</style> of such games is simply the phases which are not the first nor the last.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Chess">Chess</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Go">Go</link></style> are classical <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Board%20Games">Board Games</link></style> with <style="CurrentLink">Middlegame</style> phases. Expanding and improving the cities in one's civilization can be viewed as the <style="CurrentLink">Middlegame</style> of the  <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Civilization%20(video%20game)%20series">Civilization series</link></style>.
In the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Starcraft%20series">Starcraft series</link></style> the <style="CurrentLink">Middlegame</style> is typically called "Mid-Game".

As its name suggests, a <style="CurrentLink">Middlegame</style> is intended to come after a <style="Link"><link="startgame">Startgame</link></style> and quite often before an <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style>. Typical patterns signifying a <style="CurrentLink">Middlegame</style> include <style="Link"><link="entrenching-gameplay">Entrenching Gameplay</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="complex-gameplay">Complex Gameplay</link></style> so putting these into importance is a way to create a <style="CurrentLink">Middlegame</style>. Examples of phases which exhibit these are <style="Link"><link="expansion">Expansion</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="exploitation">Exploitation</link></style> respectively. For games where <style="Link"><link="exploitation">Exploitation</link></style> is the last phase, <style="Link"><link="construction-scoring-phase-shift">Construction/Scoring Phase Shift</link></style> is likely to become important.

Some patterns may be more interesting to consider for a <style="CurrentLink">Middlegame</style> phase than for other phases. <style="Link"><link="balancing-effects">Balancing Effects</link></style> make most sense to apply here since they are mostly irrelevant before and may make player efforts pointless later one. For similar reasons, and due to the typical complexity of <style="CurrentLink">Middlegame</style> phases, it may also be appropriate to highlight the skills that are the intended indications of <style="Link"><link="gameplay-mastery">Gameplay Mastery</link></style> here as well.

Often involving <style="Link"><link="complex-gameplay">Complex Gameplay</link></style>, the <style="CurrentLink">Middlegame</style> phase is likely to have <style="Link"><link="stimulated-planning">Stimulated Planning</link></style> that sometimes can turn into <style="Link"><link="analysis-paralysis">Analysis Paralysis</link></style>. Like most other phases, it allows the development - and promotes the use of - <style="Link"><link="strategic-knowledge">Strategic Knowledge</link></style>.
